content: Wow. It’s clear the vast majority of those commenting on this piece have never read more that what is placed in front of them and just react to trigger words without understanding the issues. If anyone actually took the time to look at the studies and data that exist, and read beyond a summary it would become clear that the point is not just that ID is difficult to obtain (though for many that is true.) It is the types of ID and the associated processes designed to make it specifically difficult for certain people to obtain those IDs that is the problem. That is what is contrary to the law. If these “Voter ID” statutes are really designed to prevent “voter fraud,” they would actually make it easier for people to get the proper identification. Read. You might actually learn something. (Maybe spend the $10 and read the actual study report.) Analysis | Do voter identification laws suppress minority voting? Yes.
